skill.name: add-event-type
skill.description: Add a new event type to the frontend feed system with corresponding React component. Use when user mentions "new event", "add event type", "event block", "new block type", or wants to display new agent output types.
skill.summary: Add a new event type to the frontend feed system with corresponding React component. Use when user m...
skill.author: AppleLamps

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and TypeScript code examples. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access capabilities. Contains only declarative instructions for adding event types.

content.user_title: Add new event types to feed
content.value_statement: Users need to display new types of agent output in the chat feed. This skill provides structured instructions for adding new event types with TypeScript interfaces, React components, and WebSocket integration.
actual_capabilities: Define new TypeScript event type interfaces
Create React block components for event display
Update EventType union with new variants
Integrate with existing feed rendering system
limitations: Does not modify backend event systems
Does not provide custom styling beyond Tailwind

use_cases.title: Display agent output types
use_cases.description: Add new block types to show different agent responses like search results, errors, or progress updates in the chat interface

use_cases.title: Extend feed functionality
use_cases.description: Create custom event displays for specialized agent capabilities beyond standard text and planning blocks

use_cases.title: Add visualization components
use_cases.description: Build new React components to visualize complex data like charts, tables, or formatted code in the feed

prompt_templates.title: Basic event type
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new 'search_result' event type to display search results in the feed

prompt_templates.title: Error block
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an 'error' event type block that shows error messages with warning styling

prompt_templates.title: Progress updates
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a 'progress' event type with percentage and status text for tracking task progress

prompt_templates.title: Custom data display
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a 'chart' event type that accepts data points and renders a visualization in the feed

output: âœ“ Defined SearchResultEventType interface with query and results array
âœ“ Created SearchResultBlock React component with result items
âœ“ Added switch case in feed rendering

best_practices: Follow existing naming conventions for consistency
Test new event types with mock WebSocket events
anti_patterns: Using inline styles instead of Tailwind classes
Forgetting to update the event handler switch case

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for adding event types to frontend applications.

faq.question: What event types can I add?
faq.answer: Any event type with defined TypeScript interfaces and React components for rendering in the feed.

faq.question: Do I need a React project?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill assumes an existing React/TypeScript project with a feed component system.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only generates code patterns. It does not access, store, or transmit any user data.

faq.question: Why is my new event not displaying?
faq.answer: Check that you added the type to the EventType union and added a case in the feed rendering switch statement.

faq.question: How is this different from custom code?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured patterns ensuring consistency with existing code conventions and TypeScript safety.
